disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 4 May to end of Thursday 5 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Sunny spells and periods of rain are forecast for Wednesday, Thursday expected to be warmer and dry.<br/><br/>A change in wind direction to become more westerly and Atlantic in origin should ensure little pollution import and enough air movement to disperse local emissions<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 5 May to end of Friday 6 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Thursday and Friday are expected to be warm and mainly dry.<br/><br/>Westerly winds should ensure little pollution import and enough air movement to disperse local emissions<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
